name: Animation

types.name: Animation
types.comment: An animation describes how a value changes over a finite period of time.

types.name: State
types.comment:
A state is the result of running an animation for some time. An animation
ends eventually so we need a case for it's final state. It can also not be done
after the time we've run it for - then we'll just keep it going next time we get
to.

values.name: append
values.type: Animation.Animation a -> Animation.Animation a -> Animation.Animation a

values.name: immediately
values.comment: Creates an animation that takes no time and assumes the specified value.

values.name: interval
values.comment:
Builds an animation spanning from zero to the time specified, and whose
value is the time that's passed since it's start.

For negative values you'll get the zero interval.

values.name: isDone
values.comment:
True when the animation is over. It can make code clearer when you want to
do things that don't depend on the final/current value.

values.name: map
values.comment: Builds an animation with the values transformed by a function.

values.name: run
values.comment: Runs an animation for some time and returns a state.

values.name: runState
values.comment: Like [`run`](#run) but accepts an animation state instead of an animation.

values.name: sample
values.comment: Gets the current value of the animation.

values.name: sampleState
values.comment:
Like [`sample`](#sample) for animation states instead of animations. If the
state [`isDone`](#isDone), then this is the final state the animation has
reached.
